segments.en: Hello, everyone.
Welcome back to another great lesson here with us at EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 欢迎回到EnglishPod的另一堂精彩课程。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
And I'm Erica.
And today we're going to be in one of my favorite sporting events, which is F1.
segments.cn: 今天我们将讨论我最喜欢的体育赛事之一，F1。

segments.en: F1 racing.
Alright.
So yeah, we're going to be talking about racing, specifically F1, which is a very popular sport all over the world.
segments.cn: 所以我们将谈论赛车，特别是F1，这是一项在全球非常受欢迎的运动。

segments.en: Yeah, I think maybe it's like number two in popularity after soccer.
segments.cn: 是的，我认为它可能是仅次于足球的第二受欢迎的运动。

segments.en: Yeah, I think so.
I have no numbers to back that up, though.
segments.cn: 不过我没有数据来支持这个说法。

segments.en: Well, they do travel everywhere.
They have races all over the world and just people love it.
segments.cn: 他们在世界各地都有比赛，人们就是喜欢它。

segments.en: Well, it is kind of a cool thing.
Well, going 300 kilometers per hour in a car is pretty cool.
segments.cn: 嗯，以每小时300公里的速度开车真的很酷。

segments.en: Alright, so let's not delay this any longer.
segments.cn: 好的，所以我们不要再拖延了。

segments.en: Let's listen to our dialogue for the first time.
segments.cn: 让我们第一次听听我们的对话。

segments.en: Heading to turn three and Lewis Hamilton tries to pass Ryconan.
segments.cn: 进入第三个弯道，Lewis Hamilton试图超越Ryconan。

segments.en: It's a close one and oh no!
Hamilton hits the wall.
He came in too fast, jammed on the brakes and spun out.
segments.cn: 他进得太快，猛踩刹车，失控了。

segments.en: We have yellow flag and the pace car is making its way into the track.
segments.cn: 我们有黄旗，安全车正在驶入赛道。

segments.en: The cleanup crew is towing the heavily damaged car and the green flag drops.
segments.cn: 清理小组正在拖走严重受损的车辆，绿旗落下。

segments.en: Ryconan is still in the lead with only two laps to go.
Smoke is coming out of his car!
He seems to be having engine trouble, he makes his way under the pit, and Fernando Alonso takes the lead!
segments.cn: 他似乎遇到了发动机故障，驶入维修区，Fernando Alonso取得了领先！

segments.en: How unlucky for Ryconan and this race is over, ladies and gentlemen.
segments.cn: Ryconan真是不幸，这场比赛结束了，女士们先生们。

segments.en: Alonso takes the checkered flag.
What an exciting race.
segments.cn: 真是一场激动人心的比赛。

segments.en: I always love a good crash when it comes to car races.
segments.cn: 我总是喜欢赛车时发生的好事故。

segments.en: I think many people go to races expecting to see a crash.
segments.cn: 我认为很多人去比赛是期待看到事故的。

segments.en: They don't want to see people getting hurt.
segments.cn: 他们并不想看到人受伤。

segments.en: No, but a little bit of... The emotion of just car crashes and stuff.
segments.cn: 不，但一点点... 车祸的刺激和其他事情。

segments.en: Yeah, a little explosion here and there.
Alright, so now we saw some really exciting language related to racing, so why don't we look at that now in language takeaway.
segments.cn: 好的，现在我们看到了一些与赛车相关的非常激动人心的语言，为什么我们不现在看看语言要点呢。

segments.en: Alright, so we were talking about that crash and I think what led to the crash was the driver jammed on the brakes.
segments.cn: 好的，我们在谈论那次事故，我认为导致事故的原因是司机猛踩刹车。

segments.en: Right, he jammed on the brakes.
To jam on the brakes.
Okay, now if I jam on the brakes... You push the brakes really really hard and really quickly and really suddenly.
segments.cn: 好的，现在如果我猛踩刹车... 你会非常用力、迅速、突然地踩刹车。

segments.en: Right, so you jam on the brakes and you stop very quickly.
segments.cn: 对，所以你猛踩刹车，迅速停下。

segments.en: So Lewis Hamilton jammed on the brakes and consequently spun out.
segments.cn: 所以Lewis Hamilton猛踩刹车，结果失控了。

segments.en: To spin out.
Okay, in the present it would be spin out.
segments.cn: 好的，现在在现在时是失控。

segments.en: Spin out.
Okay, so imagine yourselves driving your car on a very wet road.
segments.cn: 好的，想象一下你在非常湿滑的路上开车。

segments.en: And then you jam on the brakes.
Right, so then the car, you kind of lose control of the car and it starts to spin.
segments.cn: 对，然后车子，你有点失去控制，开始旋转。

segments.en: It goes in circles.
That would be to spin out.
This has actually happened to me more than once.
segments.cn: 这实际上发生在我身上不止一次。

segments.en: Really?
Yeah.
Were you okay?
Yeah, I was fine, I was fine.
Okay, so the car spun out.
Now, in racing you always see this really cool car come out and be ahead of everyone when there's an accident.
segments.cn: 现在，在赛车中，你总是会看到一辆非常酷的车在事故发生时领先所有人。

segments.en: Right, that's called the pace car.
The pace car.
Pace car.
Now, why is it called the pace car?
Because it sets the pace.
Okay, the pace or the speed.
So pace means speed.
So this car comes out and no other car can pass it.
segments.cn: 所以这辆车出来，其他车不能超过它。

segments.en: Everyone must go at the same speed.
segments.cn: 每个人都必须以相同的速度行驶。

segments.en: Right, the pace car.
Pace car.
Alright, so after there's an accident, the clean up crew must come out.
segments.cn: 好的，所以在发生事故后，清理小组必须出来。

segments.en: Okay, clean up crew.
Clean up crew.
Alright, so crew, this is an interesting word.
segments.cn: 好的，团队，这是一个有趣的词。

segments.en: When we talk about a crew, we talk about a group of people who work together.
segments.cn: 当我们谈论团队时，我们指的是一群一起工作的人。

segments.en: Okay, but for example, in an office, can I have a crew?
segments.cn: 好的，但例如，在办公室，我可以有一个团队吗？

segments.en: Not really.
Not commonly, right?
Yeah, it's people who work together and they use their hands to work.
segments.cn: 是的，这是一起工作的人，他们用手工作。

segments.en: They do manual labor.
Okay, so I can say for example, a construction crew.
segments.cn: 好的，所以我可以说，例如，一个建筑团队。

segments.en: That's right, or maybe the ground crew at the airport.
segments.cn: 没错，或者机场的地勤团队。

segments.en: Okay, or the flight crew.
Also at the airport.
Alright.
Well, in the airplane.
So that's a crew.
So clean up crew.
Clean up crew.
Now, they came out to take that car away, that broken or damaged vehicle, so they were towing it.
segments.cn: 现在，他们出来拖走那辆破损或受损的车辆，所以他们在拖车。

segments.en: Toe.
Okay, the verb to tow.
To tow.
So what does it mean when you tow something or you tow a car?
segments.cn: 那么拖动某物或拖动一辆车是什么意思？

segments.en: You pull something behind you.
So if you're a truck, that might pull a car behind you.
segments.cn: 所以如果你是一辆卡车，可能会把一辆车拉在你身后。

segments.en: That's a tow truck.
A tow truck.
Now this happens commonly if you park your vehicle where you are not supposed to.
segments.cn: 现在，如果你把车停在不该停的地方，这种情况很常见。

segments.en: That's right, and your car will get towed.
Your car gets towed.
Very good.
Alright, so we saw five really great words related to racing.
segments.cn: 好的，所以我们看到五个与赛车相关的非常棒的词。

segments.en: And now, why don't we listen to our dialogue again, and then we'll look at some other interesting phrases.
segments.cn: 现在，我们为什么不再听一遍我们的对话，然后再看看一些其他有趣的短语呢？

segments.en: Welcome back, race fans!
My name is Rick Fields, and as always, I'm joined by my partner in crime, Bob Copeland.
segments.cn: 我叫Rick Fields，和我一起的是我的搭档Bob Copeland。

segments.en: We're in the last stretch of this very exciting race, and Kimi Raikonnen is leading the pack, with only four laps to go.
segments.cn: 我们正处于这场非常激动人心的比赛的最后阶段，Kimi Raikonnen领先，剩下四圈。

segments.en: They are heading to turn three, and Lewis Hamilton tries to pass Raikonnen.
segments.cn: 他们正驶向第三个弯道，Lewis Hamilton试图超越Raikonnen。

segments.en: It's a close one, and oh no!
Hamilton hits the wall!
He came in too fast, jammed on the brakes, and spun out.
segments.cn: 他进得太快，猛踩刹车，失控了。

segments.en: We have a yellow flag, and the pace car is making its way onto the track.
segments.cn: 我们有黄旗，安全车正在驶入赛道。

segments.en: The cleanup crew is towing the heavily damaged car, and the green flag drops.
segments.cn: 清理小组正在拖走严重受损的赛车，绿旗落下。

segments.en: Raikonnen is still in the lead, with only two laps to go.
Smoke is coming out of his car.
He seems to be having engine trouble.
segments.cn: 他似乎遇到了发动机故障。

segments.en: He makes his way into the pit, and Fernando Alonso takes the lead!
segments.cn: 他驶入维修区，Fernando Alonso取得了领先！

segments.en: How unlucky for Raikonnen, and this race is over, ladies and gentlemen!
segments.cn: Raikonnen真是不幸，这场比赛结束了，女士们先生们！

segments.en: Alonso takes the checkered flag!
Okay, so now we're back, and I think it's time for us to take a look at some phrases in Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 好的，现在我们回来了，我想是时候看看一些流利构建器中的短语了。

segments.en: Well, even though we're talking about F1 racing, a lot of the language can be used in many different situations.
segments.cn: 虽然我们在谈论F1赛车，但很多语言可以在许多不同的场合使用。

segments.en: So let's look at some of those phrases now.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看这些短语。

segments.en: When Rick Fields introduced his co-host, he said, My partner in crime.
segments.cn: 当Rick Fields介绍他的共同主持人时，他说，我的搭档。

segments.en: Partner in crime.
Partner in crime.
Now, it's not that they're actually committing a crime.
segments.cn: 现在，他们并不是在真正犯罪。

segments.en: No, they're not actually bank robbers.
segments.cn: 不，他们并不是银行抢劫犯。

segments.en: But it's a very common and friendly way of saying, My good friend, or my...
segments.cn: 但这是一种非常常见和友好的说法，意思是，我的好朋友，或者我的...

segments.en: The person I do everything with.
segments.cn: 我一起做所有事情的人。

segments.en: Right, my co-worker, for example, right?
segments.cn: 对，我的同事，比如说，对吧？

segments.en: But a co-worker who's a really, really good friend.
segments.cn: 但一个真的非常好的朋友。

segments.en: Who you spend a lot of time with.
segments.cn: 你和他花了很多时间在一起。

segments.en: Okay, so that's your partner in crime.
It's just a metaphor, right?
So, partner in crime.
Now, what about the next phrase?
The last stretch.
The last stretch.
Last stretch.
Okay, before we explain this word, let's listen to some examples, and then we'll come back and talk about it.
segments.cn: 好的，在我们解释这个词之前，让我们听一些例子，然后再回来讨论。

segments.en: Example one.
We are finally in the last stretch of a very long week.
segments.cn: 我们终于进入了漫长一周的最后阶段。

segments.en: I can't wait to go home.
Example two.
He's in the last stretch of his college years, and soon he'll graduate.
segments.cn: 他正处于大学生涯的最后阶段，很快就要毕业了。

segments.en: Okay, so I understand that to mean, like, the final length of time.
segments.cn: 好的，我理解这意味着，像是，最后的时间段。

segments.en: Right, the last or final moments before an ending.
Alright, so, the last stretch.
The last stretch.
Now, when you're on the last stretch, you just have a few minutes to go.
segments.cn: 现在，当你在最后阶段时，你只剩几分钟了。

segments.en: To go.
Yeah, to go.
Now, this preposition, too, and the verb go, is very easy, right?
segments.cn: 现在，这个介词和动词go也很简单，对吧？

segments.en: Right.
But if you say, five minutes to go, what does that mean?
segments.cn: 但如果你说，五分钟剩下，是什么意思？

segments.en: Five minutes left.
Left.
It doesn't mean it's five minutes to actually leave, right?
segments.cn: 这并不意味着实际上要离开五分钟，对吧？

segments.en: Right.
No, it means you must complete five minutes before you can be finished.
segments.cn: 不，这意味着你必须完成五分钟才能结束。

segments.en: Okay.
So, it's not about exiting.
Right.
I have five days to go before I go on vacation.
segments.cn: 我还有五天才能去度假。

segments.en: So, it's not about you actually going on the vacation, it's about you passing those five days.
segments.cn: 所以，这不是关于你实际上去度假，而是关于你度过这五天。

segments.en: Can you give us another example?
segments.cn: 你能给我们另一个例子吗？

segments.en: How about, we have 45 minutes to go before the end of the day.
segments.cn: 比如，我们还有45分钟才能结束这一天。

segments.en: That's right.
So, to go.
Left.
Exactly.
To go.
Alright, now let's take a look at our last phrase.
segments.cn: 好的，现在让我们看看最后一个短语。

segments.en: Close one.
A close one.
A close one.
Alright, another interesting phrase made up of simple words.
segments.cn: 好的，另一个由简单词组成的有趣短语。

segments.en: So, let's listen to some examples to help us understand it.
segments.cn: 所以，让我们听一些例子来帮助我们理解。

segments.en: Example one.
That was a close one.
The teacher almost caught me cheating.
Example two.
It's a close one.
We are tied and the game is almost over.
segments.cn: 我们打平，比赛快结束了。

segments.en: Example three.
My girlfriend almost found the presents I hid under the bed.
segments.cn: 我女朋友差点发现我藏在床下的礼物。

segments.en: It was a close one.
Okay, so a close one.
It means... A situation that is almost dangerous, but wasn't.
segments.cn: 这意味着... 一种几乎危险但并没有的情况。

segments.en: But wasn't.
Exactly.
That was a close one.
Okay.
So, very good phrases.
I think we can take a lot from this and apply it outside of F1, right?
segments.cn: 我认为我们可以从中学到很多，并在F1之外应用，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah.
Alright, so let's listen to the dialogue for the last time and then we'll come back and talk about this great sport.
segments.cn: 好的，所以让我们最后再听一遍对话，然后再回来谈谈这项伟大的运动。

segments.en: Welcome back racing fans.
My name is Rick Fields.
And as always, I'm joined by my partner in crime, Bob Copeland.
segments.cn: 和我一起的是我的搭档Bob Copeland。

segments.en: We're in the last stretch of this very exciting race.
segments.cn: 我们正处于这场非常激动人心的比赛的最后阶段。

segments.en: And Kimi Raikonen is leading the pack with only four laps to go.
They're heading to turn three and Lewis Hamilton tries to pass Raikonen.
segments.cn: 他们正驶向第三个弯道，Lewis Hamilton试图超越Raikonnen。

segments.en: It's a close one and... Oh no!
Hamilton hits the wall.
He came in too fast.
Jammed on the brakes and spun out.
We have yellow flag and the pace car is making its way into the track.
segments.cn: 我们有黄旗，安全车正在驶入赛道。

segments.en: The clean up crew is towing the heavily damaged car and the green flag drops.
segments.cn: 清理小组正在拖走严重受损的赛车，绿旗落下。

segments.en: Raikonen is still in the lead with only two laps to go.
segments.cn: 莱科宁仍然领先，剩下两圈。

segments.en: Smoke is coming out of his car!
He seems to be having engine trouble.
segments.cn: 他似乎遇到了发动机故障。

segments.en: He makes his way under the pit.
And Fernando Alonso takes the lead!
segments.cn: 费尔南多·阿隆索取得了领先！

segments.en: How unlucky for Raikonen.
And this race is over, ladies and gentlemen.
segments.cn: 这场比赛结束了，女士们先生们。

segments.en: Alonso takes the checkered flag.
Alright, so F1 racing.
Erika, do you like it?
Do you watch it?
Yeah, F1 is pretty neat.
You know, cars that drive fast.
That's pretty interesting.
Well, for some people it isn't.
Why do I want to go to a race and just see fast cars?
segments.cn: 我为什么要去比赛只看快车？

segments.en: Okay, I would never go to a race, but I think I would maybe watch the highlights on TV.
segments.cn: 好吧，我绝对不会去比赛，但我可能会在电视上看精彩片段。

segments.en: Well, actually this year it's really exciting because, again, we're going to have a night race.
segments.cn: 其实，今年真的很激动，因为我们将有一场夜赛。

segments.en: I think it's in Malaysia or somewhere in Asia.
segments.cn: 我想是在马来西亚或亚洲的某个地方。

segments.en: That they're going to race at night.
Oh, so that's pretty special, huh?
Well, it's like harder to see and you're going really fast.
segments.cn: 嗯，晚上看更难，而且你开得很快。

segments.en: Imagine.
So I hear you're going to the F1 this year.
Yes, this year I'm going to go to the Shanghai circuit to watch the F1 race.
segments.cn: 是的，今年我将去上海赛道观看F1比赛。

segments.en: So I'm really excited about that.
I haven't ever been to one, so it should be fun.
segments.cn: 我从未去过，所以应该会很有趣。

segments.en: Alright, well I hope you get to see some interesting things like car crashes and pace cars.
segments.cn: 好吧，我希望你能看到一些有趣的事情，比如车祸和安全车。

segments.en: What about you guys, our listeners?
Are you fans of F1?
Have you ever been to an F1 race?
Exactly.
Send us your questions and comments and also your stories.
segments.cn: 给我们发送你们的问题和评论，还有你们的故事。

segments.en: I think we have listeners from all over the world.
segments.cn: 我想我们有来自世界各地的听众。

segments.en: We have a lot of listeners in Brazil and I know that there is a Grand Prix there.
segments.cn: 我们在巴西有很多听众，我知道那里有一场大奖赛。

segments.en: So tell us, how did it go?
segments.cn: 所以告诉我们，比赛怎么样？

segments.en: Do you like it?
You can visit us at EnglishPod.com where Marco and I are around to answer your questions.
segments.cn: 你可以访问我们的网站EnglishPod.com，马尔科和我会回答你们的问题。

segments.en: Alright, any Canadian race car drivers?
segments.cn: 好吧，有加拿大的赛车手吗？

segments.en: Yeah, there was one recently.
Someone, some something.
Alright, maybe our users know which one is the Canadian.
segments.cn: 好吧，也许我们的用户知道哪个是加拿大的。

segments.en: So we'll see you guys there.
Thanks for listening.
Bye.
